head.title: To Train and Keep Good Teachers

hedline.hl1: To Train and Keep Good Teachers

abstract.p: Brent Muirhead letter on Aug 24 article cites importance of retaining experienced teachers

block.p: Re ''Less Training, More Teachers: New Math for Staffing Classes'' (front page, Aug. 24):

Re ''Less Training, More Teachers: New Math for Staffing Classes'' (front page, Aug. 24):

Those who advocate recruiting teachers through reduced educational requirements are offering only a partial solution to the teacher shortage. Unfortunately, our educational reformers and politicians have failed to address the problem of retaining teachers.

As a veteran educator, I have seen a growing number of teachers leave the profession for another career. In Georgia, approximately one-third of public school teachers leave the profession before their fifth year. It is a negative trend that creates schools filled with new and inexperienced teachers. The constant turmoil over teacher issues threatens to undermine efforts to improve our schools.
